Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 辞典……辞典…… はい、はい、はい。 確かに借りたわねぇ。
Entry.EnglishText: A dictionary... Oh, right, I believe I did borrow one.

Entry.JapaneseText: 取りに来てもらっちゃって なんだか悪いわねぇ。 はい、コレ。
Entry.EnglishText: Making you come all the way here... I'm sorry. Please take it.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『辞典』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Obtained "Dictionary."

Entry.JapaneseText: あんまり大きな声じゃ言えないけど、 スカラベ様のガジュマ嫌いは 相当なものよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd rather not say it out loud, but I find Lord Scarabe's hate for Gajuma unbefitting.

Entry.JapaneseText: 嫌な思いをしたくなかったら、 早いところ街を出たほうがいいわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: It makes me feel uncomfortable. I'd rather leave this town as soon as possible.
Entry.Notes: deepL says: If you don't want to have a bad experience, you'd better get out of town as soon as possible. probably fine, but putting it here just to be safe.

Entry.JapaneseText: お連れにガジュマがいるみたいだけど、 この街では、あまりガジュマと仲良く しないほうがいいわよ……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like one of your companions is a Gajuma, but I recommend not being buddy-buddy with their kind in this town...

Entry.JapaneseText: わかってもわからなくても いいから、覚えておきなさいね。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't care if you understand it or not, just keep it in mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの娘さん…… あまりこの街をウロウロしない ほうがいいいよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Young lady, I'd recommend that you don't loiter around that much here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 困った事があるなら、 橋の向こうに住んでる ガジュマのところにお行きよ。
Entry.EnglishText: If someone troubles you, please escape to the Gajuma living on the other side of the bridge.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたち、よそから来た みたいだから教えてあげるけど、 橋の向こうへは行っちゃダメだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You guys seem like outsiders, so let me give you a piece of advice. You musn't go to the other side of the bridge.

Entry.JapaneseText: あそこに住んでるガジュマたちは、 ヒューマの事を良く思ってない からね……
Entry.EnglishText: The Gajuma living there don't really get along with Huma like you, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街ではガジュマは 腹が立つ事も多いと思うけど、 がまんするのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: This town is quite hostile towards Gajuma, so please hang in there...
Entry.Notes: deepL says: I know Gajuma is often angry in this city, but be patient: ......

Entry.JapaneseText: それができないなら、 すぐに街を出たほうがいいわ。
Entry.EnglishText: If you can't cope with it, I recommend you leave this town as soon as possible.

Entry.JapaneseText: お仲間のガジュマさんは、 ずいぶん立派に見えるわね。 でも、その分、目立つから 気をつけるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Your companion seems like a respectable person, but you stand out quite a bit, so I recommend you take care when going around town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あのスカラベさんが、 ガジュマと話し合いなんて…… これまでずっとはねつけてたのに。
Entry.EnglishText: To agree to converse with Gajuma... Lord Scarabe has never done such a thing before...
Entry.Notes: deepL says: ...... that scarab, I can't believe he's talking to Gajuma. ...... I've been rebuffing him all this time.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの人は、 見た目以上に腹黒い人…… 気をつけなさいね。
Entry.EnglishText: That man is far more wicked than he looks. Please be careful.

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様の演説、ご立派だったわ。 街のみんなも、良く考えてくれると いいんだけどね……
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Agarte's speech was quite magnificent. I just hope everyone in town will reflect on what she said.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんな事があった後だし、 軍が監視するのは仕方ないけど……
Entry.EnglishText: After all the things that happened, it's no surprise that the military would start monitoring us, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: こんなギスギスした雰囲気じゃ、 ヒューマとガジュマが仲直りするのも 簡単じゃないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Making Gajuma and Huma get along when things are this tense... It won't be an easy task.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんな事があった後だし、 軍が監視するのは仕方ないけど……
Entry.EnglishText: After all the things that happened, it's no surprise that the military would start monitoring us, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: こんなギスギスした雰囲気じゃ、 ヒューマとガジュマが仲直りするのも 簡単じゃないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Making Gajuma and Huma get along when things are this tense... It won't be an easy task.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ジルバ様って人の演説は、 アガーテ様とまるで正反対ね……
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva's speech and Lady Agarte's speech sound almost the opposite of each other.

Entry.JapaneseText: 国の偉い人が、ガジュマだけを 守るような事を言うなんて…… 心配よね……
Entry.EnglishText: It is worrisome that such a high-standing person would be so biased towards Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマの対立が ますますひどくなってるわ……
Entry.EnglishText: The conflict between Huma and Gajuma is slowly growing more intense...

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様のあの演説の意味、 もっとよく考えて欲しいわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Please, I wish everyone would just stop and think about what Lady Agarte said!

Entry.JapaneseText: 寒さがこたえて…… 私はここから祈らせてもらうわ。
Entry.EnglishText: The cold is getting to me... I'll be here praying for the moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: 少しずつだけど、色々考える<Yellow>ヒト<White>が 増えて来てるみたい……
Entry.EnglishText: Little by little, more and more <Yellow>people<White> have begun to think about it.

Entry.JapaneseText: この街の対立も、 少しは減るかもしれないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Hopefully the conflict within this town will eventually decline...

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベさんはこの街の有力者で、 みんなに尊敬されてるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone respects Lord Scarabe, as he's an influential person, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はあんまり、あの人の事、 好きにはなれないのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't bring myself to like a person such as him...

Entry.JapaneseText: 家事って休みがないのよね。 たまには画集でも見て 息抜きをしたいわ……
Entry.EnglishText: You really don't get a break while cleaning the house. At the very least, I'd like to relax with a picture book at hand.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私にあなたの持っている 画集を貸してくれるの？
Entry.EnglishText: Will you lend me that picture book you have?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『画集』を貸し出しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Lent the "Picture Book."

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとうね。 家事の息抜きに 見させてもらうわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks. I'll go over it when I'm not busy doing housework.

Entry.JapaneseText: あらやだ、私の勘違い？ ごめんなさいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh dear, did I misunderstand? I'm sorry.

Entry.JapaneseText: あらっ。いらっしゃい。 この画集は素晴らしかったわ。 じゅうぶん息抜きさせてもらったわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, welcome! The picture book was quite pleasant. It helped me relax quite a bit.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『画集』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Retrieved "Picture Book."

Entry.JapaneseText: お礼といってはなんだけど、 これを持っていってちょうだい。
Entry.EnglishText: Please accept this, as a token of my gratitude.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごめんなさい。 この画集、もうちょっとだけ 貸してちょうだいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Apologies, but can you please lend this picture book to me a little bit longer?

Entry.JapaneseText: さぁ、息抜きもしたことだし、 がんばって部屋のお掃除でも しようかしら。
Entry.EnglishText: Now that I've had a good chance to relax, I suppose it's time for me to get back to cleaning my house!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『足を組む美女』 十数年前、ベルサスを訪れた画家、 ケイトがこの家の奥さんにひと目ぼれし、 強引にモデルになってもらって 二日で描き上げた作品。なかなか美人。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cross-legged Woman - Around a decade ago, a painter called Kate fell in love with the lady of this house and finished this piece in two days after coercing her into becoming his model. She is quite beautiful.
